stories.text:
I have a diverse environment, and varying configs across the various build profiles on various virtualized machines.

It feels wrong to have a repo with a bunch of submodules and bash scripts, so I have to ask: How are you managing centralized configs at scale?
stories.title: Ask HN: How are you managing centralized configs at scale?

stories.text: People say Geekbench and Cinebench, two of the most popular benchmarks in the CPU world, are synthetic benchmarks and don't represent real world performance. The question is, how can we benchmark and compare Apple Silicon, Intel and AMD chips that represent real world use the best?
stories.title: Ask HN: What is the best way to benchmark Apple Silicon, Intel and AMD chips?
